data.title: Biggest/most popular video game characters you had never heard of until they were announced for Smash Bros
data.meta_description:
EDIT: For the record, I'm 38 and this isn't a joke thread.

As a kid, I never played RPGs. None of my friends did either.

So...I had no idea who these guys...
data.text:
ElectricBlanketFire

What year is this?

Oct 25, 2017

32,761

May 17, 2021

#1

EDIT: For the record, I'm 38 and this isn't a joke thread.

As a kid, I never played RPGs. None of my friends did either.

So...I had no idea who these guys were before they were announced for Smash:

What about you?

Last edited: May 17, 2021

RockmanBN

Visited by Knack - One Winged Slayer

Oct 25, 2017

28,962

Cornfields

#2

So Terry wasn't Ken with a hat?

Bare in mind my first consoles were PS1, Game Boy Colour and N64. Although I had heard of Sonic before I had heard of Mario.

May 17, 2021

#20

I didn't know anything about Metroid, The Legend of Zelda, Earthbound, and Star Fox before Smash 64. I owned F-Zero for the SNES, but I didn't know any of the racers, or if it had any characters, so Captain Falcon was new to me too.

Didn't know about Fire Emblem and Ice Climber before Melee.

Didn't know who Lucas was before Brawl.

I learned who Shulk was during Smash 4 rumor speculation before his reveal, but before that, all I knew was that Xenoblade was a game that existed and nothing else. My first thought when seeing his name was that it was shorthand for "She-Hulk."

Last edited: May 17, 2021

Captain Falcon with Smash 64, but only got to discover he was part of a racing game with Smash Brawl lmao

For me, maybe Pit when he was revealed in Brawl and I seem to remember not knowing Palutena since I'd never played Uprising.

May 3, 2021

6,593

May 17, 2021

#26

I have no idea how you could not know who Cloud was until 2015 unless you were born in, like, 2008. I cannot fathom it.

I didn't know any of the Kid Icarus characters. I didn't know who Metaknight or DDD were. I didn't know Samus, Little Mac, Ike, Mr. G&W, C. Falcon, ROB, Ness/Lucas, Wii Fit Trainer.

I didn't know why Wario looked like a biker. I didn't know the WarioWare games even existed and I didn't play one until WarioWare Gold for the 3DS.

Last edited: May 17, 2021

May 17, 2021

#27

Never heard of Cloud and Sephiroth? Never? I mean, not KNOWING them, sure - like, Cloud Strife, the guy with the Buster Sword, former SOLDIER, all the details. But never heard of them? "Spiky blonde guy from FFVII" not ringing a bell? Impossible, I refuse to believe it.

I didn't know Samus or Fox among the starters for Smash 64, by virtue of being like 7 at the time. Those are probably the biggest.

Ness and Captain Falcon were the ones that confused me the most as a kid. I knew who Samus and Kirby were because I had Super Metroid as a kid and a friend had Kirby Superstar but Ness and Falcon were a total mystery

i think the only characters i didn't know previous to SSB were Ness, Lucas, Marth and Roy. in SSB64, i had a big ??? when Ness showed up as challenger approaching since i had no idea who he was and i knew the other 11 well. same with SSBM and Marth and Roy. Lucas in SSBB was probably the last one i had never heard of until i played the SSB game he showed up in.

every other new comer from SSB4 and SSBU i've known in some form before their SSB debut. even Terry i knew about him before SSB.

By Brawl I was a big enough nerd to know everyone (including 99% of the ATs and stickers).

#31

As a kid I didn't know anything about Samus, Capt.Falcon, or Ness.

Then Melee came out and I didn't know anything about Ice Climbers, G&W, or the Fire Emblem characters Marth or Roy.

With Brawl and Smash 4, I didn't know anything about the Fire Emblem characters there, either.

The newest Smash Bros. has Fire Emblem and Xenoblade characters that I didn't know anything about beforehand.

I'm old so I knew all the big characters. Ness in the original then Marth and Roy in Melee were the only characters in Smash I'd never heard of, and that's pretty much to be expected given the status of those series outside of Japan at the time.

Real answer: Marth & Roy

I had no idea what Fire Emblem was prior to Smash Melee releasing. I have to imagine this was true for a lot of gamers in the Western territories.

With Melee I also didn't know who Marth, Roy, Ice Climbers, or Game & Watch were(by the time the game was out I was definitely on forums like gamefaqs and neoseeker so I learned about them soon enough) but I think after that I pretty much knew who everyone was to a degree by being online

bruh...

idontbelieveyou.gif

I don't believe you don't know who Cloud is at the very least. Just being on a videogame forum you will absorb that through osmosis.

(...man, Cloud and Sephiroth, though?)

Cloud? I don't believe you

.

I refuse to believe you didn't know Cloud and Sephiroth when they were added. If they were in the N64 version then sure but otherwise nope.

I have no idea how you could not know who Cloud was until 2015 unless you were born in, like, 2008. I cannot fathom it.

Never heard of Cloud and Sephiroth? Never? I mean, not KNOWING them, sure - like, Cloud Strife, the guy with the Buster Sword, former SOLDIER, all the details. But never heard of them? "Spiky blonde guy from FFVII" not ringing a bell? Impossible, I refuse to believe it.

OP is lying about Cloud unless they learned about the concept of video games during the year that Smash Wii U released. For like a million reasons, it's impossible to be into video games and have never seen or heard of Cloud.

...why would I make this up? I'm not joking.

I had no interest in Final Fantasy, never played any of the games and none of my friends did either.

May 17, 2021

#40

I mean, back when I was a kid Smash was one of the first series I got into, so most of the characters were new to me. I recognized a few of the Melee additions I guess.

Going by the numbering on the Smash website, ROB is probably the newest character that I wasn't previously familiar with. I've known every other character from Brawl onwards.

#41

I admit when Byleth was annouced, i had no idea who the hell that character was considering that the most popular characters from the three houses were Edelgard, Dimitri and Claude at the time when i didn't look too much into the game.

On a somewhat related note, I didn't know who the hell Geese Howard was considering my knowledge of SNK lore is very limited among king of fighters and having somewhat known reference of terry with his hat. Back then, Tekken never got any guest character among Gon and Akuma so I actually thought he was an original character for the game. It wasn't until I researched about it that i found out how badass he actually is from hiss original games.

HustleBun

Nov 12, 2017

6,077

May 17, 2021

#49

...why would I make this up? I'm not joking.

The reason no one believes you is because Cloud is everywhere. If you said you hadn't played FF7 or realized that was the game he was from, that makes sense. You lost people by saying you had never even heard of Cloud. Cloud has been in multiple game cameos, he was in a movie, he's been referenced in other movies and TV shows, on the cover of magazines and even products like Cup Ramen and Butterfinger candy bars. Cloud has also been a "dream character" referenced in Smash discussions for nearly 20 years. And while we're at it, you can't post on a gaming forum anywhere without seeing Cloud pop up.

I mean it's possible you're not joking. But the reasons above are why we're mostly assuming it was a prank or a troll post.

Real question- were you fairly new to gaming when Smash Wii U released?
